tmpls.name: Card 1

fields: What is the curse of dimensionality in NLP?

Problem: Sparse data in high-dimensional spaces
Effect: Most vectors are nearly orthogonal
Solution: Embeddings reduce to dense, lower dimensions
Example: One-hot vectors vs 300d word embeddings

Purpose: Split text into meaningful units for processing
Challenges: Punctuation, contractions, out-of-vocabulary words
Modern: Subword tokenization (BPE, SentencePiece)
Benefit: Balance between vocabulary size and coverage
What is the difference between precision and recall?

Precision: TP/(TP+FP) - accuracy of positive predictions
Recall: TP/(TP+FN) - fraction of positives found
Trade-off: High precision → low recall, vice versa
F1: Harmonic mean balances both metrics
What are n-grams and why are they useful?

Definition: Contiguous sequences of n tokens
Examples: Unigrams (words), bigrams (word pairs), trigrams
Use: Language modeling, feature extraction
Trade-off: Higher n captures more context but increases sparsity
